Service level was good, and we left filled to the brim.

Naked Fish is the best. I lived in Las Vegas for 3 years, and have been a frequent visitor before and since. I've been everywhere, and Naked Fish takes the gold. The sushi speaks for itself. They have an incredibly varied menu. There are so many flavor combinations both traditional and unique. The fish are as fresh as can be. What sets this place apart is the staff and the atmosphere they create. They are simply wonderful. They make you feel like royalty from the moment you step in until a week after your trip. They are incredibly knowledgable about the menu and sushi in general. And they're extremely skilled in taking care of you during your meal. Naked fish is my favorite restaurant, any where any food.

Great Sushi oasis in the desert!  I went this place based on a recc. from a co-worker, while in town on business.  I am glad that we did.  Got the WSOP roll, salad and some Nigiri tuna.  All great.  Have gone back a couple of times since.  It does get crowded in the evening (after 7) and is intimate, so get there early to avoid waiting outside in the las vegas summer.

This place is dangerous because almost everything is delicious and you want more of everything. 

Food: 
The numerous times I came here almost everything was delicious. Whether it was their Ultimate Naked Roll, Kai, Dark Circle, or Dragon Fly everything was just good. Their gyoza, soft shell crab,  mackerel, shrimp tempura, and Asian lamb chop, and Japanese spaghetti were all good as well. But one thing that really stood out and still bothered me was the bonzai roll, it just had the fishy seafood taste which is a sign of bad sushi. It was really bad. Could have just been a bad roll. Everything else on the menu is good though.

Service:
Wait staff is very friendly and helpful. They were very friendly with the young child that was in our group, giving him a toy car and quick to clean up the small mess he made. But, the wait staff wasn't shy about offering our Vietnamese co-worker a fork, since he kept dropping his sushi with the chopsticks. BURNNNNNNN!

Price:
After comparing to other sushi places, Naked Fish is price fairly competitive based on what you get. You can't compare to all you can eat places, but if you want quality sushi without breaking the bank this is the place to go. Rolls range from $6 all the way to the $15 Ultimate Naked Roll. 

Great high quality affordable sushi, with fish being shipped daily from Japan. If it wasn't for the mishap with the bonzai roll, this place deserves a 5 star.

Sushi off the strip is pretty commonplace in Vegas though you never know what you'll get once you get to a sushi restaurant. Naked Fish's was a great surprise to us.

We had great service that was incredibly friendly. We started off with the Screaming Orgasm salad (an ahi tuna over some fresh greens and a vinagrette dressing), which is not on the menu. That was great and then we had a bunch of nigiri sushi and rolls. Everything was fresh and excellent but the thing that really got us to rave "this is REALLY good!" was the Japanese Lasagna. Wow, we could not get enough of that - very addicting.

My only regret?  My 4 year old daughter (who LOVES sushi rolls) was so tired from the day's events that she ended up sleeping through all of dinner and missed out. My 7 year old son, however, thought the rolls he had were delicious.

Even better, since my son is allergic to cow's milk, they had a mango sorbet. It was a bit pricey for a sorbet but it was actually frozen inside half of a mango skin and was quite plentiful. Turns out that they get the sorbet imported in from Italy already packed into the mango skin. My son was in heaven!

When we are in Vegas again, we are certainly going to be hitting Naked Fish's again!  We are already recommending it to our friends who are visiting Vegas too.
It was not that good, I did enjoy the music, the chef attitude

Best sushi ever! Seriously. 

Naked Fish's is a small, minimalistic place pretty far from the Strip. I found it only thanks to my friend, who visits Vegas more frequently and knows a bit more of the city that the main turist areas. The place didn't really seem much but the food turned out to be great! The service was also nice, very informative and quick. They knew their food. 

I went with the group of 9-10 people, so we ordered a lot of different things: sashimi, nigiri, some standard rolls, special house rolls and baked rolls. We didn't ordered it all together, but all rolls were served very quickly and we didn't have to wait for anything. And as much as I usually don't care much for sashimi and nigiri, I loved them here. The salmon was really good, even by itself. Other than that, Dragon, Rock'N Roll, Kiss Me and Lobster were fantastic. They also have a super tasty raspberry lemonade and a free appetizer for a Yelp check in. I still miss this place sometimes... :(
Good stuff but didn't take my yelp coupon. :( cuz it wasn't the right size appetizer. I would of known if they offered different sized appetizers.

Food was good but service was terrible. They weren't even busy. Waitress came over ONCE the entire meal and that was to take our order 20 minutes after we sat down. We had to ask the bus boy for the check. Free check in offer gets you a small edamame or cucumber salad.

I would come back and get my food to go.

This is second time I gave this place a chance because so many of the locals have recommended this place.  But, this time was worse than the first time I tried it.  Most of all, the quality of their fish is marginal.  They weren't fresh (hamachi was dry and most all other fish lacked any kind of flavor or taste of freshness) and their rice isn't cooked or prepared right.  Secondly, their fish and rice portions are very small.  You really don't get much for the price you pay for.  In fact, my sushi slices were cut so thin and small that I could hardly taste the flesh of the fish.  The makis...their sauces contain too much sugar.  And again, very small potions. 

Their green tea has no flavor either.  It's green in color, that's about it.  I spent $53 for 4 orders of sushi, one spicy salmon roll, and fresh shrimp (the head was fried but was too greasy to eat).  The place isn't good and it is relatively expensive.  I don't mind paying for good food.  Sasabune of Los Angeles is my favorite sushi place  They do everything right and use the freshest high quality fish.  And they do their rice right.  

Find a better place than Naked Fish Sushi.

I need to start off by saying I am allergic to all seafood but go to sushi places because others want to go. I have been here a bunch of times and have always been happy with the food. The veggie and avocado rolls are great! The spicy chicken app is tasty. The Kirin is on tap and the happy hour is pretty great! 

One thing we always talk about when we go is how awesome this place would be to watch fireworks on the strip. I'm not sure we would ever go, but definitely a place to consider!

Went here yesterday, Saturday night about 9 pm. We were seated almost right away and the rest of my table had their drinks before I even made it back from washing my hands. I ordered a carafe of one of the unfiltered sakes. It was so good and served in a cute little glass and jar. 

One if my friends ordered a roll wrapped in cucumber and said it was one of the best he'd ever had. My other friend ordered the yellowtail roll and commented that it was the most flavorful yellowtail he'd ordered in quite some time. One of my girlfriends and I ordered the house salad which was huge but only five dollars!!! I also got the fried rice which isn't on the menu but I asked  and they said the would make it special.  So delicious.

Overall, wonderful service, delicious food, good drinks, and at a reasonable price. Would definitely recommend.

Over the years, I've been to this restaurant on more than a few occasions. As mentioned in other Yelp reviews, Wanda is great for suggestions (seems like she's been there forever...).  On my most recent visit, as soon as my Mrs and I walked in...Wanda immediately recommended one of their daily specials: "Bluefin Tuna Collar!" She told us that if we like Hamachi Kama (yellowtail collar), we will really enjoy the taste of Bluefin Collar. She added that the bluefin collar is a treat as they only get it on occasion and it takes a little longer to prepare.

We told her we would try it...while we were waiting for it to be prepared, we each started off with Asari Clam Miso soup and we shared a House salad. We added orders of the yellowtail jalapeño and a Kamikaze roll. Everything was tasty, but we were anxious to try the bluefin tuna collar...when it arrived (took about 20 mins) it was worth the wait. It was simply delicious! It was tender & succulent...to get to the "meaty" portion we had dig inside & under the collar bone...so you have to be willing to do the "extra work." 

I've never had a bad meal at this restaurant...I usually like to select items off their "Daily Specials" menu board or I ask Wanda for her recommendations. Also, my experience with their service is that they won't pamper you...but are responsive when you have a request.

Showed up, was closed for the company christmas party, we understood - was no problem - and the waitress came running out after us with a $10 gift certificate so we'd come back.

Naked Fish always impresses me and tonight was no exception even though we didn't even eat there.

Arguably the best sushi I've ever had. Quality fish prepared and served by chefs that really "know" good sushi. Wanda was incredible and made great recommendations. Our group had a sashimi boat (among other things) and there was not one piece of fish I didn't absolutely love. I would highly encourage anyone who appreciates good quality sushi to dine here.

This is the best sushi place I Have ever been to! Everything is always fresh and the staff is just as amazing.  Wonda always takes great care of me and goes beyond to make sure our experience is the best.  If you haven't been here, I suggest you go!

Operating in the sushi market in the town of Las Vegas is tough. "I've eaten sushi all over the nation and this is the best"...if I had a dime for every person that said that, well you can do the math. Funny when you see the lady sitting at a cheap probably 3 month life span sushi restaurant eating frozen tuna raving about the freshness and quality. Here is the low down because your hearing from someone that really knows: 
FISH COMES IN ALL TIERS AND PRICES FROM THE SUPER CHEAP TO TOP QUALITY (Remember you are what you eat) 
1. All the purveyors nationwide will sell frozen tuna if given the chance (all you can eat sushi bars Todai, I Love sushi etc, etc. and cheap poke places) Let me tell you the process: The manufacturers will take old tuna of poor quality that didn't sell at market usually staring to turn rotten and brown. They then fabricate and process using carbon monoxide , smoke and food coloring, hence the bright red color. After this they vacuum seal, freeze and sell to fish purveyors for pennies who then sell to restaurants for just a little more. Then YOU get stoked when you can enjoy all you can eat tuna sushi at a shitty sushi bar that is fluorescent red colored because all you worry about is quantity not quality. 
2. All Hamachi sashimi is farm raised poor quality from Asia. Wild caught Yellowtail or its' cousins will run a market price of $40 - $50 a pound translating to $12- $14 for 2 pieces of sushi. 
3. Salmon mostly farm raised because the wild stuff can cost a restaurant double triple and they figure that they can dress it up enough with ponzu sauce or mayo to the point where no once can tell the difference. Also the farm raised salmon live in very contaminated polluted environments with the water being constantly diluted with antibiotics sometimes (USDA and FDA knows this) with agents that are carcinogenic and/or harmful to human beings. 

Anyway enough on the boring education, ignorance is bliss. Naked Fish is by far the best place in Las Vegas to get sushi off the strip that is unpretentious and with a reasonable price tag considering the quality. Sen of Japan is great but don't want to pay $300 a head for a Nobu's knock off. Service at Naked Fish is great and they take the time to get to know their customers. My only complaint is that I wish they would expand to more traditional Japanese dishes, but given their diverse clientele it is understandable.

uggg I hate to do this, but I gotta give em 3 stars only because of the particular reason that I went there for.

I went for their late night happy hour and PLEASE don't get me wrong. I will always give this place 5 stars for service and 5 stars for quality. But their sushi roll selection on their late night happy hour is VERY limited.

Here's the issues I have..

#1 If you have a funky name like Lisa Lisa roll then put the description of what's in the roll with the item, I shouldn't have to flip through the other section of the full menu to find out the details.  

#2 They didn't even have a basic spicy tuna roll on happy hour (I've never heard of that before but sure enough, they didn't offer it)

#3 They were actually slightly higher priced then some other places like Lahaina Grill for their happy hour rolls (but to give them credit, their quality is above Lahaina Grill) 

However I'd rather goto Lahaina Grill for a larger selection of happy hour rolls vs the very limited choices I had here.

I was quite disappointed with the choices.  Again, please don't get me wrong, their quality of what they offer on their menu is VERY good and slightly higher prices because of that.  They even have a very good lunch menu. However you really need to improve on that happy hour menu and because of that I won't go back when I'm lookin for some cheap happy hour specials vs all you can eat.

:-(  :-(  :-(  :-(

The place is quite small. When you first walk in, you get welcomed by the usual Japanese greeting. Everyone is sweet and has a big smile on their faces. You can tell the team was jiving and having a great time! The ambiance is perfect for a late night dinner with excellent happy hour specials after 10 pm. There is a limited selection of alcohol. My boyfriend and I shared three rolls: The Lisa Lisa roll, the Sunset Roll, and Tiger/Dragon roll. 

My favorite was the Lisa Lisa. The outside of the roll has an incredible crunch to it and a mayo sauce that is probably the best I have ever had. The fish tasted like fresh fish that did not have the nasty fishy taste that we have all unfortunately experienced once in our lives. Thank goodness this place has FRESH ingredients all around. You see the sushi chef's make your food to order. The place looks and feels clean. The waitress was sweet and did an excellent job giving us recommendations. I highly recommend the Tiger/Dragon roll if you love eel and avocado. The sunset roll was also tasty with a hint of spice to it since the inside had spicy tuna. 

We did not get dessert, but the ice cream that passed by us looked pretty tasty! Get a large Sapparo there or the plum wine. It will add a nice addition to your overall meal. I will definitely come back here again since it is reasonably priced and away from the strip so getting there is much more convenient. I recommend calling ahead to see how long the wait is. On weekends, the place can get pretty busy! No worries though there is a PT's nearby which you can stop in there for a quick drink while you wait for your table.

Tried it for lunch special after school one day...do not regret it! freakin fabulous.
I got this bento lunch special for $8-9. It had a whole california roll, mixed tempura, gyoza, teriyaki chicken, small salad, big pile of rice, and miso soup. It was delicious and I can't believe I ate the whole thing. I can't wait to return.
lunch special I believe, is 11am-3pm.

I've been here once.  It was kinda late and pretty busy.  I don't know if they were short staffed or we caught a shift change because our server seemed to change about 3 times, including being waited on by the hostess or manager.  It was confusing but didn't really effect the level of service.  The food was fresh and came out quickly.  Moderately priced for Sushi.  Caught the beginning of the late happy hour on some of the meal which was a plus.

A very satisfying sushi experience at a fair price! The atmosphere is quite casual and comfortable with cozy tables and booths and a petite sushi bar with five or six seats. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, they won't brow beat you if your party decides to hang out and drink for a few hours. I have only tried the sushi and appetizers, which are both quite good with fresh fish and creative preparations. Our fav roll is the Tiger&Dragon which consists of a shrimp tempura roll covered with spicy tuna AND unagi(eel). I would quickly and heartily recommend Naked for a weekly date night spot, or to even try once while visiting Vegas with friends.

When in the mood for sushi, I usually always go here. The staff is consistent, friendly and they remember their regulars. I have never sat at a table or gone with a large group so this review is just based on chilling at the sushi bar and enjoying the food. 

They are generally always busy which is great and important for a sushi place. I used to have a saying that I only eat the fish if I can see the water, but Vegas has SOO many fish and sushi places in town that fresh fish is flown into town all the time. 

Quality of food here is really good and the chef's are fun and interactive.. Occasionally I would ask them to look out for a certain type of fish and they occasionally will get it in and remember that it was you who asked for it.... The only reason I did not give it five stars was that they don't carry some fish and other japanese dishes that I got used to having all the time when I was living in San Francisco.... but hey, this is Las Vegas... 

Bonus points for being open late and having a lovely wait staff...

My favorite sushi place in town! The servers are always so sweet and friendly and the food is to die for. Most sushi places I've tried are really inconsistent when it comes to food, but Naked Fish's is always great. Wanda is so great and I always feel so welcome whenever I walk in. Even when they're slammed with customers, they'll go out of their way to make sure you're taken care of. Seriously, check this place out!!

P.S. Definitely try the Lobster Roll. It's my favorite thing in the world right now. It's completely insane!

Food is not that spectacular but good place for dating or chill out. Sushi is a little better than the average and of course better than all you can eat qualities. Their Roppongi roll is probably the best.  This place is more like izakaya/tapas, so if you are looking to be full or eat a lot, it's not a great choice. They have a quiet few selection of wines and sake, so if you like to drink liquor and have some good fresh tapas, it is a good place to go.

This place is first class! I was away from the strip and having a great time. Of all places they have Shisito peppers which is extremely rare due the geographical location. We were able to satisfy our cravings!!! I love u naked!

The ambiance is relaxing and dim. Its a small nice place great for romantic dates or chill night out with friends. 

They gave me 2 big desserts on my birthday. 

They actually have really generous servings with good presentation.
This place is my favorite in town! Great service, not to mention Wanda was in on my engagement proposal!! What a great place to celebrate and eat!!

I love these naked fish. I highly suggest arriving at 10 PM (they are open until 2 AM every night) and taking advantage of the happy hour menu. You can get three rolls and a beer for a very reasonable price, as well as some budget friendly appetizers. Although their normal menu is fantastic, whenever we go at happy hour we end up paying half the price and still feel stuffed. 

This is a small restaurant, but unless you go on a weekend evening, there shouldn't be much if any wait. Service is fast and friendly, and it is quite cute inside, too. 

They do this great tuna salad (I forget the actual name of it), and they have some really inventive and tasty original rolls. The fish is always fresh and cut well. Other highlights have been the green bean tempura, squid, and any roll that involves an element of crunch. 

Parking is no problem as it is in a strip mall (it is in a nice enough neighborhood, though).

Came during happy hour and ordered a ton of sushi. Fast and friendly service and good sushi. Suggestions are GT/R roll, spider roll and Japanese lasagna! Only reason I gave 4 stars was my brother in law ordered donkatsu and it came without rice. We were told rice was extra! Other than that had a great experience but wish they had an all you can eat because ordering outside of happy hour would be a bit more than I would spend.
Best place for rolls. Fresh fish, perfectly cooked rice, tasty sauces. A little bit more expensive than average sushi place but totally worth it. Great ambience and service too.
This place is awesome! Recommended by the valet guy after watching a show.  Sushi was fresh and loved the miso soup.
